title: badmintonInfo website
overview: badmintonInfo is a dynamic website that showcases badminton gear and professional players that use them. The site utilized XAMPP for local development environment, PHP for server-side scripting, and MySQL for database management. UI wise, this was the first time I designed a site using Bootstrap for clean, easy, and reusable code.

title: Portfolio websites
description: my old static and current react website
overview: This website is supposed to be the culmination of everything I've learned so far, I made it using React (Vite) and Bootstrap. This website is a remake and upgrade of my old website that I made during reading break in an effort to learn React.

title: YouTube shorts converter
description: converts shorts to full video player

title: SFU Quizlet
overview: SFU Quizlet was a final project for my Android Development class, I was in charge of creating and designing the front page as well as the course list. The app was written in Kotlin, and firebase was used for our database that contained all the courses, questions/answers, as well as user data.

title: Movie Dataset Cleaning
overview: An Observable notebook using JavaScript, VegaLite and D3 to analyze and clean two datasets, each containing ~2000 movies. Using JS, I  processed and cleaned the datasets to ensure accuracy and consistency. Subsequently, I employed VegaLite, D3 to visualize and present the insights derived from the cleaned datasets.
